intro: Calylophus berlandieri, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to blue, often appearing in the early morning. The plant is a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Botanically, it belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other members like Ipomoea and Pharbitis.
